functions.name: StartWithRunContext
functions.desc: Starts a new yieldable coroutine from the given function. Function should be a declaration of 'void Func()'.

functions.decl: awaitable@ StartWithRunContext(RunContext runContext, CoroutineFuncUserdata@ func, ref userdata)
functions.desc: Starts a new yieldable coroutine from the given function which also provides a userdata handle parameter. Function should be a declaration of 'void Func(ref@)'.

functions.name: StartWithRunContext
functions.decl: awaitable@ StartWithRunContext(RunContext runContext, CoroutineFuncUserdataInt64@ func, const int userdata)
functions.desc: Starts a new yieldable coroutine from the given function which also provides a userdata signed integer. Function should be a declaration of 'void Func(int64)'.

functions.name: StartWithRunContext
functions.decl: awaitable@ StartWithRunContext(RunContext runContext, CoroutineFuncUserdataInt64@ func, const int64 userdata)
functions.desc: Starts a new yieldable coroutine from the given function which also provides a userdata signed integer. Function should be a declaration of 'void Func(int64)'.

functions.name: StartWithRunContext
functions.decl: awaitable@ StartWithRunContext(RunContext runContext, CoroutineFuncUserdataUint64@ func, const uint userdata)
functions.desc: Starts a new yieldable coroutine from the given function which also provides a userdata unsigned integer. Function should be a declaration of 'void Func(uint64)'.

functions.name: StartWithRunContext
functions.decl: awaitable@ StartWithRunContext(RunContext runContext, CoroutineFuncUserdataUint64@ func, const uint64 userdata)
functions.desc: Starts a new yieldable coroutine from the given function which also provides a userdata unsigned integer. Function should be a declaration of 'void Func(uint64)'.

functions.name: StartWithRunContext
functions.decl: awaitable@ StartWithRunContext(RunContext runContext, CoroutineFuncUserdataDouble@ func, const double userdata)
functions.desc: Starts a new yieldable coroutine from the given function which also provides a userdata floating point number. Function should be a declaration of 'void Func(double)'.

functions.name: StartWithRunContext
functions.decl: awaitable@ StartWithRunContext(RunContext runContext, CoroutineFuncUserdataString@ func, const string&in userdata)
functions.desc: Starts a new yieldable coroutine from the given function which also provides a userdata string. Function should be a declaration of 'void Func(const string &in)'.

functions.name: ExecutingPlugin
functions.desc: Gets the currently executing plugin.

functions.name: AllPlugins
functions.desc: Gets all plugins that are loaded.

functions.name: UnloadedPlugins
functions.desc: Gets the identifiers of all unloaded plugins. Note that this function may be slow!

functions.name: GetPluginFromID
functions.desc: Gets a plugin from its ID.

functions.name: GetPluginFromSiteID
functions.desc: Gets a plugin from its site ID, if set.

functions.name: LoadPlugin
functions.decl: Plugin@ LoadPlugin(const string&in path, PluginSource source, PluginType type)
functions.desc: Loads a plugin into memory from the given absolute path and returns a handle to the plugin.

functions.name: UnloadPlugin
functions.desc: Queues a plugin to be unloaded from memory completely when it is safe to do so. Note that this will invalidate the plugin object passed in on the next frame! Do not use the Plugin handle after calling this!

functions.name: ReloadPlugin
functions.desc: Queues a plugin to be reloaded when it is safe to do so. Note that this will invalidate the plugin object passed in on the next frame! Do not use the Plugin handle after calling this!

functions.name: OpenSettings

args.name: plugin
args.desc: The plugin to display in the settings window. Use null for the currently executing plugin.

functions.desc: Opens the settings window to the page of the given plugin.

functions.name: SaveSettings
functions.desc: Forces Openplanet to save its settings immediately. Normally this happens on game shutdown or when the settings window is closed. You should not have to call this function unless you know you really need to!

functions.name: IsDeveloperMode
functions.desc: Returns true if developer mode is currently enabled.

functions.name: IsSchoolModeWhitelisted
functions.desc: Returns true when the current session is whitelisted by school mode, and school mode is enabled. If you want to check if school mode is enabled, use the `SIG_SCHOOL` preprocessor define instead.

functions.name: OpenplanetVersion
functions.desc: Returns the current version of Openplanet.

functions.name: OpenplanetVersionDate
functions.desc: Returns the current date of Openplanet's build.

functions.name: OpenplanetBuildInfo
functions.desc: Returns the current build info of Openplanet's build.

functions.name: Terminate
functions.desc: Immediately terminates the game process. This is the same as clicking "Exit" in the Openplanet menu.

functions.desc: Returns the original bytes as a backup.

functions.name: GetToken
functions.desc: Starts a task that authenticates the current user with the Openplanet and Nadeo backends. This is useful to authenticate users with external third party services securely. Note that you must have authentication enabled in your plugin admin panel for this to work. The resulting token must be sent to your server, which should validate it using the Openplanet.dev API.

functions.name: FromStorageFolder
functions.desc: Gets the absolute path for a file in your plugin's storage folder. This is typically C:\Users\Username\OpenplanetNext\PluginStorage\YourPluginIdentifier. When calling this function and the folder doesn't exist yet, it will automatically be created for you.

functions.name: FromDataFolder
functions.desc: Gets the absolute path for a file in the data folder. This is typically C:\Users\Username\OpenplanetNext

functions.name: FromAppFolder
functions.desc: Gets the absolute path for a file in the game's applicationfolder. This is where your game is installed, for example D:\Games\Trackmania

functions.name: FromUserGameFolder
functions.desc: Gets the absolute path for a file in the game's user folder. This is what the game considers the user folder, for example C:\Users\Username\Documents\Trackmania. Note that it is possible for this function to return only the given filename without any absolute path, in case the game doesn't have the necessary info, but you should consider this to happen very rarely (if ever).

functions.name: GetExtension
functions.desc: Gets the file extension for the given path, including the period. If there is no file extension, this returns an empty string. For example, `hello.txt` will return `.txt`.

functions.name: HasExtension
functions.desc: Returns true if the given path has a file extension.

args.name: path
args.desc: The original path.

args.name: extension
args.desc: The new extension for the given path. This does not need to start with a period, but including a period is accepted.

functions.decl: string ChangeExtension(const string&in path, const string&in extension)
functions.desc: Changes the file extension in the given path and returns the new path. If the original path has no file extension, this will add the given file extension.

functions.name: RemoveExtension
functions.desc: Removes the file extension from the given path. If there is no file extension, this returns the original path. For example, `hello.txt` will return `hello`.

functions.name: Join
functions.decl: string Join(const string&in a, const string&in b)
functions.desc: Combines two paths into one. This automatically glues the paths with forward slashes where needed. For example, passing `hello` and `world` will return `hello/world`, but so will passing `hello/` and `world`. You should not combine multiple absolute paths using this function.

args.name: caseSensitive

functions.desc: Returns true if the given 2 paths can be considered equal.

functions.name: GetDirectoryName
functions.desc: Returns the path to the directory of the containing path, including the path separator, excluding the filename. For example, `hello/world/foo.txt` will return `hello/world/`.

functions.name: GetFileName
functions.desc: Gets the file name and extension of the given path. For example, `hello/world/foo.txt` will return `foo.txt`.

functions.name: GetFileNameWithoutExtension
functions.desc: Gets the file name of the given path without the extension. For example, `hello/world/foo.txt` will return `foo`.

functions.name: SanitizeFileName
functions.desc: Sanitizes the given filename and replaces invalid characters with underscores. You may use this for both file names and folder names.

methods.name: SubStr

args.name: index
args.desc: The index at which to start. When a negative number is used, the start index is subtracted from the length of the string. For example; for the string "Hello", SubStr(-3) returns "llo".

methods.desc: Returns the remainder of the string after the given index. For example; for the string "Hello", SubStr(1) returns "ello".

methods.name: SubStr

args.name: index
args.desc: The index at which to start. When a negative number is used, the start index is subtracted from the length of the string. For example; for the string "Hello", SubStr(-3, 2) returns "ll".

args.name: length
args.desc: The length of the substring. When a negative number is used, the length of the source string becomes the base of the length. For example; for the string "Hello", SubStr(0, -1) returns "Hell".

methods.decl: string SubStr(int index, int length) const
methods.desc: Returns a portion of the string from the index and length. For example; for the string "Hello", SubStr(1, 3) returns "ell".

classes.name: HttpRequest
classes.desc: Holds the state of an executing HTTP request.

func.name: $beh3
func.desc: Creates a new GET request with the given URL.

func.name: $beh3
func.decl: Net::HttpRequest@ HttpRequest(const string&in url, const string&in body)
func.desc: Creates a new POST request with the given URL and body.

methods.name: Start
methods.desc: Starts executing the request. Does nothing if the request has already started.

methods.name: StartToFile
methods.desc: Starts executing the request, writing the response to the given path. Throws an exception if the request has already started.

methods.name: Finished
methods.desc: Returns true if the request has finished execution. This will return true even in the case of an error.

methods.name: ProgressDownload
methods.desc: Returns the number of bytes that has been downloaded from the server.

methods.name: ProgressDownloadTotal
methods.desc: Returns the total number of bytes that are expected to be returned from the server. Note that this can be 0 before the server has sent its `Content-Length` header, or if it never sends the header at all.

methods.name: ProgressUpload
methods.desc: Returns the number of bytes that has been uploaded to the server.

methods.name: ProgressUploadTotal
methods.desc: Returns the total number of bytes that are expected to be uploaded to the server.

methods.name: Cancel
methods.desc: Cancels the request. Throws an exception when the request is not yet started.

methods.name: Error
methods.desc: Returns an error message, if there was an error. Otherwise, this returns an empty string. This function is useful in the rare case that `ResponseCode()` returns 0.

methods.name: ResponseCode
methods.desc: Returns the HTTP response code, for example 200 or 404.

methods.name: ResponseHeader
methods.desc: Gets the value of a specific response header. The key is case insensitive.

methods.name: ResponseHeaders
methods.desc: Gets a dictionary of all response headers.

methods.name: String
methods.desc: Returns the response body as a string.

methods.name: Json
methods.desc: Returns the response body as a Json value.

methods.name: Buffer
methods.desc: Returns the response body as a MemoryBuffer.

methods.name: SaveToFile
methods.desc: Saves the response body to a file. The given path should be an absolute path.

props.name: Headers
props.desc: Headers for the request. Note that if the `User-Agent` header is not present, one will automatically be added with basic information about your plugin. It is therefore not recommended to pass in a custom `User-Agent` header.

props.name: Redirect
props.desc: Whether or not to follow redirects.

classes.name: Socket
classes.desc: A non-blocking TCP socket.

methods.name: Connect
methods.decl: bool Connect(const string&in host, uint16 port)
methods.desc: Start a connection to the given host and port. This is non-blocking and will immediately return. Use `IsReady()` to wait for the connection to be ready.

methods.name: Listen
methods.decl: bool Listen(const string&in host, uint16 port)
methods.desc: Starts listening on the given host and port.

methods.name: Listen
methods.desc: Starts listening on the given port using 0.0.0.0 as the host. Note that this will open up the port to the LAN, which may not be what you want.

methods.name: Close
methods.desc: Closes the socket.

methods.name: Accept
methods.desc: When this socket is listening, attempts to accept a client connection if one is trying to connect. If there is, it will be returned. If no client is waiting, this will return null.

methods.name: GetRemoteIP
methods.desc: Get the host IP address associated with this socket.

methods.name: CanRead
methods.desc: This method is deprecated and should not be used. Consider using IsReady(), IsHungUp(), or Available() instead, depending on your use-case.

methods.name: CanWrite
methods.desc: This method is deprecated and should not be used. Use IsReady() instead.

methods.name: IsReady
methods.desc: Returns true if the socket is ready to be used.

methods.name: IsHungUp
methods.desc: Returns true if the socket state currently has the hangup flag. Note that this flag may be set while there is still data in the buffer that can be read.

methods.name: Available
methods.desc: Returns the number of bytes available to be read from the socket buffer.

methods.name: ReadRaw
methods.desc: Reads the given number of bytes and return it as a string.

methods.name: ReadBuffer
methods.desc: Reads the given number of bytes and return it as a MemoryBuffer.

methods.name: WriteRaw
methods.desc: Writes the given string to the socket as-is. Returns false if the write did not succeed. Note that this behavior differs from `Write(const string &in)`.

methods.name: ReadLine
methods.desc: Attempts to read up until the next newline character, and outputs the string (including the newline character) in `str`. If no newline character is encountered, it will return false, leave `str` unmodified, and no bytes will be consumed from the buffer.

methods.name: WriteLine
methods.desc: Writes a line of text to the socket. Returns false if the write did not succeed. This behaves the same as `WriteRaw()`, except a newline is appended.

methods.name: ReadInt8
methods.desc: Reads an 8 bit signed integer from the buffer.

methods.name: ReadInt16
methods.desc: Reads a 16 bit signed integer from the buffer.

methods.name: ReadInt32
methods.desc: Reads a 32 bit signed integer from the buffer.

methods.name: ReadInt64
methods.desc: Reads a 64 bit signed integer from the buffer.

methods.name: ReadUint8
methods.desc: Reads an 8 bit unsigned integer from the buffer.

methods.name: ReadUint16
methods.desc: Reads a 16 bit unsigned integer from the buffer.

methods.name: ReadUint32
methods.desc: Reads a 32 bit unsigned integer from the buffer.

methods.name: ReadUint64
methods.desc: Reads a 64 bit unsigned integer from the buffer.

methods.name: ReadFloat
methods.desc: Reads a 32 bit float from the buffer.

methods.name: ReadDouble
methods.desc: Reads a 64 bit float from the buffer.

methods.name: ReadString
methods.desc: Reads a string length from the buffer as a 32 bit unsigned integer, followed by the actual string. This complements `Write(const string &in)`.

methods.name: Write
methods.desc: Writes an 8 bit signed integer to the socket. Returns false if the write did not succeed.

methods.name: Write
methods.desc: Writes a 16 bit signed integer to the socket. Returns false if the write did not succeed.

methods.name: Write
methods.desc: Writes a 32 bit signed integer to the socket. Returns false if the write did not succeed.

methods.name: Write
methods.desc: Writes a 64 bit signed integer to the socket. Returns false if the write did not succeed.

methods.name: Write
methods.desc: Writes an 8 bit unsigned integer to the socket. Returns false if the write did not succeed.

methods.name: Write
methods.desc: Writes a 16 bit unsigned integer to the socket. Returns false if the write did not succeed.

methods.name: Write
methods.desc: Writes a 32 bit unsigned integer to the socket. Returns false if the write did not succeed.

methods.name: Write
methods.desc: Writes a 64 bit unsigned integer to the socket. Returns false if the write did not succeed.

methods.name: Write
methods.desc: Writes a 32 bit float to the socket. Returns false if the write did not succeed.

methods.name: Write
methods.desc: Writes a 64 bit double to the socket. Returns false if the write did not succeed.

methods.name: Write
methods.desc: Writes a 32 bit unsigned integer for the length of the string to the socket, followed by the actual string. Returns false if the write did not succeed. Note that this behavior differs from `WriteRaw()`.

methods.name: Write

args.name: size
args.desc: The number of bytes to read from the MemoryBuffer. If this is 0, the remainder of the available bytes is used.

methods.desc: Reads a number of bytes from the given MemoryBuffer and writes them to the socket.

classes.name: Sample
classes.desc: Represents an audio sample.

classes.name: Voice
classes.desc: Represents a currently playing voice of audio.

methods.name: GetPosition
methods.desc: Gets the current position within the sample in seconds.

methods.name: SetPosition
methods.desc: Sets the current position within the sample in seconds. Note that this is not an immediate action because voice mixing is performed in a different thread. (`GetPosition()` will not immediately return the same value as you pass here.)

methods.name: GetLength
methods.desc: Gets the length of the sample in seconds. Note that on streamed samples, this may be expensive on the first call as it may have to decode the entire stream.

classes.name: PluginAuthTask
classes.desc: An asynchronous authentication task with the Openplanet and Nadeo backends for the current plugin.

methods.name: Finished
methods.desc: Returns true if the task has finished execution. This will return true even in the case of an error. Only when this returns true should you call IsSuccess(), Error(), or Token().

methods.name: IsSuccess
methods.desc: Returns true if the task was successful, or false if not. If this returns false, you can call Error() to get more information about what went wrong.

methods.name: Error
methods.desc: If IsSuccess() returns false, this will return the description of the error.

methods.name: Token
methods.desc: Returns the authentication token as a string. This is the token you should send to your server, which should validate it using the Openplanet.dev API. Note that the token is only valid for 5 minutes. Because of this, you should not be storing this token! Instead, exchange it with a token of your own from your backend which you keep validated for a longer period of time.

classes.name: Node
classes.desc: A node within an XML tree.

methods.name: Name
methods.desc: Get the tag name of the node. For example, <abc> will return "abc".

methods.name: FirstChild
methods.desc: Get the first child node within this node.

methods.name: LastChild
methods.desc: Get the last child node within this node.

methods.name: Child
methods.desc: Get the child node within this node that matches the tag name. For example, to get the tag <abc>, call Child("abc").

methods.name: NextSibling
methods.desc: Get the next sibling in the parent of this node. For example, if the node you're calling it on is <abc>, it will return <def> in this tree: <root><abc/><def/></root>

methods.name: Attribute
methods.decl: string Attribute(const string&in name, const string&in def = "") const
methods.desc: Get an attribute within this node. For example, the node <abc x="y"> has an attribute named "x" with a value "y". If the attribute does not exist, the def parameter is returned.

methods.name: Content
methods.desc: Get the content text within this node.

classes.name: Document
classes.desc: An XML tree document.

methods.name: LoadString
methods.desc: Load an XML tree into this document by parsing the given string.

methods.name: Root
methods.desc: Get the root node of the document.

classes.name: ListClipper
classes.desc: Helper class to manually clip large lists of items. To use this, create an instance on the stack. Call Begin, or pass the the total item count the constructor which will call Begin for you. Make a while loop with the condition `clipper.Step()`. Inside of the loop, make a for loop with `int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++`. Inside of the for loop, put whatever UI elements you need for the item at index i. Remember that all UI items in the list must be the same height for ListClipper to work.

methods.name: Step
methods.desc: Call until it returns false. The DisplayStart/DisplayEnd fields will be set and you can process/draw those items.

methods.name: End
methods.desc: Automatically called on the last call of Step() that returns false.

enums.name: ItemFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to UI::PushItemFlag().

NoTabStop.d: Disable keyboard tabbing. This is a "lighter" version of UI::ItemFlags::NoNav.

NoNav.d: Disable any form of focusing (keyboard/gamepad directional navigation and SetKeyboardFocusHere() calls).

NoNavDefaultFocus.d: Disable item being a candidate for default focus (e.g. used by title bar items).

ButtonRepeat.d: Any button-like behavior will have repeat mode enabled (based on io.KeyRepeatDelay and io.KeyRepeatRate values). Note that you can also call IsItemActive() after any button to tell if it is being held.

AutoClosePopups.d: MenuItem()/Selectable() automatically close their parent popup window.

enums.name: InputTextFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to UI::InputText().

AllowTabInput.d: Pressing TAB input a '	' character into the text field

EnterReturnsTrue.d: Return 'true' when Enter is pressed (as opposed to every time the value was modified). Consider looking at the IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit() function.

EscapeClearsAll.d: Escape key clears content if not empty, and deactivate otherwise (contrast to default behavior of Escape to revert)

CtrlEnterForNewLine.d: In multi-line mode, validate with Enter, add new line with Ctrl+Enter (default is opposite: validate with Ctrl+Enter, add line with Enter).

Password.d: Password mode, display all characters as '*', disable copy

AutoSelectAll.d: Select entire text when first taking mouse focus

ParseEmptyRefVal.d: InputFloat(), InputInt(), InputScalar() etc. only: parse empty string as zero value.

DisplayEmptyRefVal.d: InputFloat(), InputInt(), InputScalar() etc. only: when value is zero, do not display it. Generally used with ImGuiInputTextFlags_ParseEmptyRefVal.

NoUndoRedo.d: Disable undo/redo. Note that input text owns the text data while active, if you want to provide your own undo/redo stack you need e.g. to call ClearActiveID().

CallbackCompletion.d: Callback on pressing TAB (for completion handling)

CallbackHistory.d: Callback on pressing Up/Down arrows (for history handling)

CallbackAlways.d: Callback on each iteration. User code may query cursor position, modify text buffer.

CallbackCharFilter.d: Callback on character inputs to replace or discard them. Modify 'EventChar' to replace or discard.

enums.name: SliderFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to UI::Slider*().

AlwaysClamp.d: Clamp value to min/max bounds when input manually with CTRL+Click. By default CTRL+Click allows going out of bounds.

Logarithmic.d: Make the widget logarithmic (linear otherwise). Consider using ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat with this if using a format-string with small amount of digits.

NoRoundToFormat.d: Disable rounding underlying value to match precision of the display format string (e.g. %.3f values are rounded to those 3 digits)

NoInput.d: Disable CTRL+Click or Enter key allowing to input text directly into the widget

WrapAround.d: Enable wrapping around from max to min and from min to max (only supported by DragXXX() functions for now.)

enums.name: ColorEditFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to UI::InputColor*().

NoAlpha.d: ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: ignore Alpha component (will only read 3 components from the input pointer).

NoPicker.d: ColorEdit: disable picker when clicking on color square.

NoOptions.d: ColorEdit: disable toggling options menu when right-clicking on inputs/small preview.

NoSmallPreview.d: ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable color square preview next to the inputs. (e.g. to show only the inputs)

NoInputs.d: ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable inputs sliders/text widgets (e.g. to show only the small preview color square).

NoTooltip.d: ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: disable tooltip when hovering the preview.

NoLabel.d: ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable display of inline text label (the label is still forwarded to the tooltip and picker).

NoSidePreview.d: ColorPicker: disable bigger color preview on right side of the picker, use small color square preview instead.

NoDragDrop.d: ColorEdit: disable drag and drop target. ColorButton: disable drag and drop source.

NoBorder.d: ColorButton: disable border (which is enforced by default)

AlphaOpaque.d: ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: disable alpha in the preview,. Contrary to _NoAlpha it may still be edited when calling ColorEdit4()/ColorPicker4(). For ColorButton() this does the same as _NoAlpha.

AlphaNoBg.d: ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: disable rendering a checkerboard background behind transparent color.

AlphaPreviewHalf.d: ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: display half opaque / half transparent preview.

AlphaBar.d: ColorEdit, ColorPicker: show vertical alpha bar/gradient in picker.

HDR.d: (WIP) ColorEdit: Currently only disable 0.0f..1.0f limits in RGBA edition (note: you probably want to use ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float flag as well).

DisplayRGB.d: ColorEdit: override _display_ type among RGB/HSV/Hex. ColorPicker: select any combination using one or more of RGB/HSV/Hex.

Uint8.d: ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0..255.

Float.d: ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0.0f..1.0f floats instead of 0..255 integers. No round-trip of value via integers.

PickerHueBar.d: ColorPicker: bar for Hue, rectangle for Sat/Value.

PickerHueWheel.d: ColorPicker: wheel for Hue, triangle for Sat/Value.

InputRGB.d: ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in RGB format.

InputHSV.d: ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in HSV format.

enums.name: SeparatorFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to UI::Separator().

SpanAllColumns.d: Make separator cover all columns of a legacy Columns() set.

enums.name: TableFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to UI::BeginTable().

enums.name: TableColumnFlags

enums.name: TableBgTarget
enums.desc: Background colors are rendering in 3 layers: Layer 0: draw with RowBg0 color if set, otherwise draw with ColumnBg0 if set. Layer 1: draw with RowBg1 color if set, otherwise draw with ColumnBg1 if set. Layer 2: draw with CellBg color if set. The purpose of the two row/columns layers is to let you decide if a background color changes should override or blend with the existing color. When using UI::TableFlags::RowBg on the table, each row has the RowBg0 color automatically set for odd/even rows. If you set the color of RowBg0 target, your color will override the existing RowBg0 color. If you set the color of RowBg1 or ColumnBg1 target, your color will blend over the RowBg0 color.

enums.name: TabBarFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to UI::BeginTab().

enums.name: TabItemFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to UI::BeginTabItem().

enums.name: Cond
enums.desc: Conditions for certain UI set operations.

enums.name: Key
enums.desc: UI-specific keys.

enums.name: MouseButton
enums.desc: UI-specific mouse buttons.

enums.name: HoveredFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to IsItemHovered.

enums.name: InputFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to Shortcut and SetNextItemShortcut.

Repeat.d: Enable repeat. Return true on successive repeats. Default for legacy IsKeyPressed(). NOT Default for legacy IsMouseClicked(). MUST BE == 1.

RouteFocused.d: Route to windows in the focus stack (DEFAULT). Deep-most focused window takes inputs. Active item takes inputs over deep-most focused window.

RouteGlobal.d: Global route (unless a focused window or active item registered the route).

RouteAlways.d: Do not register route, poll keys directly.

RouteOverFocused.d: Option: global route: higher priority than focused route (unless active item in focused route).

RouteOverActive.d: Option: global route: higher priority than active item. Unlikely you need to use that: will interfere with every active items, e.g. CTRL+A registered by InputText will be overridden by this. May not be fully honored as user/internal code is likely to always assume they can access keys when active.

RouteUnlessBgFocused.d: Option: global route: will not be applied if underlying background/void is focused (== no Dear ImGui windows are focused). Useful for overlay applications.

RouteFromRootWindow.d: Option: route evaluated from the point of view of root window rather than current window.

Tooltip.d: Automatically display a tooltip when hovering item [BETA] Unsure of right api (opt-in/opt-out)

enums.name: MouseCursor
enums.desc: Cursors that can be passed to SetMouseCursor.

enums.name: PlotFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::BeginPlot`.

NoTitle.d: The plot title will not be displayed (titles are also hidden if preceeded by double hashes, e.g. `##MyPlot`)

NoLegend.d: The legend will not be displayed

NoMouseText.d: The mouse position, in plot coordinates, will not be displayed inside of the plot

NoInputs.d: The user will not be able to interact with the plot

NoMenus.d: The user will not be able to open context menus

NoBoxSelect.d: The user will not be able to box-select

NoFrame.d: The ImGui frame will not be rendered

Equal.d: X and y axes pairs will be constrained to have the same units/pixel

Crosshairs.d: The default mouse cursor will be replaced with a crosshair when hovered

enums.name: Axis
enums.desc: Plot axes.

enums.name: AxisFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::SetupAxis`.

NoLabel.d: The axis label will not be displayed (axis labels are also hidden if the supplied string name is nullpt

NoGridLines.d: No grid lines will be displayed

NoTickMarks.d: No tick marks will be displayed

NoTickLabels.d: No text labels will be displayed

NoInitialFit.d: Axis will not be initially fit to data extents on the first rendered frame

NoMenus.d: The user will not be able to open context menus with right-click

NoSideSwitch.d: The user will not be able to switch the axis side by dragging it

NoHighlight.d: The axis will not have its background highlighted when hovered or held

Opposite.d: Axis ticks and labels will be rendered on the conventionally opposite side (i.e, right or top)

Foreground.d: Grid lines will be displayed in the foreground (i.e. on top of data) instead of the background

AutoFit.d: Axis will be auto-fitting to data extents

RangeFit.d: Axis will only fit points if the point is in the visible range of the **orthogonal** axis

PanStretch.d: Panning in a locked or constrained state will cause the axis to stretch if possible

LockMin.d: The axis minimum value will be locked when panning/zooming

LockMax.d: The axis maximum value will be locked when panning/zooming

enums.name: Location
enums.desc: Used to position items on a plot (e.g. legends, labels, etc.)

enums.name: LegendFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::SetupLegend`.

NoButtons.d: Legend icons will not function as hide/show buttons

NoHighlightItem.d: Plot items will not be highlighted when their legend entry is hovered

NoHighlightAxis.d: Axes will not be highlighted when legend entries are hovered (only relevant if x/y-axis count > 1)

NoMenus.d: The user will not be able to open context menus with right-click

Outside.d: Legend will be rendered outside of the plot area

Horizontal.d: Legend entries will be displayed horizontally

Sort.d: Legend entries will be displayed in alphabetical order

enums.name: MouseTextFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::SetupMouseText`.

NoAuxAxes.d: Only show the mouse position for primary axes

NoFormat.d: Axes label formatters won't be used to render text

ShowAlways.d: Always display mouse position even if plot not hovered

enums.name: Scale
enums.desc: Axis scale.

enums.name: Marker
enums.desc: Marker specifications.

enums.name: Bin
enums.desc: Different automatic histogram binning methods (k = bin count or w = bin width).

enums.name: Cond
enums.desc: Represents a condition for `SetupAxisLimits` etc.

None.d: No condition (always set the variable), same as `Always`

Once.d: Set the variable once per runtime session (only the first call will succeed)

enums.name: Colormap
enums.desc: Built-in colormaps

enums.name: ColormapScaleFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::ColormapScale`.

NoLabel.d: The colormap axis label will not be displayed

Opposite.d: Render the colormap label and tick labels on the opposite side

Invert.d: Invert the colormap bar and axis scale (this only affects rendering; if you only want to reverse the scale mapping, make scale_min > scale_max)

enums.name: LineFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::PlotLine`.

Segments.d: A line segment will be rendered from every two consecutive points

Loop.d: The last and first point will be connected to form a closed loop

SkipNaN.d: NaNs values will be skipped instead of rendered as missing data

NoClip.d: Markers (if displayed) on the edge of a plot will not be clipped

Shaded.d: A filled region between the line and horizontal origin will be rendered; use PlotShaded for more advanced cases

enums.name: BarsFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::PlotBars`.

Horizontal.d: Bars will be rendered horizontally on the current y-axis

enums.name: ErrorBarsFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::PlotErrorBars`.

Horizontal.d: Bars will be rendered horizontally on the current y-axis

enums.name: ShadedFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::PlotShaded`.

enums.name: ScatterFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::PlotScatter`.

NoClip.d: Markers on the edge of a plot will not be clipped

enums.name: BarGroupsFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::PlotBarGroups`.

Horizontal.d: Bar groups will be rendered horizontally on the current y-axis

Stacked.d: Items in a group will be stacked on top of each other

enums.name: StemsFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::PlotStems`.

Horizontal.d: Stems will be rendered horizontally on the current y-axis

enums.name: StairsFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::PlotStairs`.

PreStep.d: The y value is continued constantly to the left from every x position, i.e. the interval (x[i-1], x[i]] has the value y[i]

Shaded.d: A filled region between the stairs and horizontal origin will be rendered; use PlotShaded for more advanced cases

enums.name: PieChartFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::PlotPieChart`.

Normalize.d: Force normalization of pie chart values (i.e. always make a full circle if sum < 0)

IgnoreHidden.d: Ignore hidden slices when drawing the pie chart (as if they were not there)

enums.name: HeatmapFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::PlotHeatmap`.

ColMajor.d: Data will be read in column major order

enums.name: HistogramFlags
enums.desc: Flags that can be passed to `UI::Plot::PlotHistogram`.

Horizontal.d: Histogram bars will be rendered horizontally (not supported by PlotHistogram2D)

Cumulative.d: Each bin will contain its count plus the counts of all previous bins (not supported by PlotHistogram2D)

Density.d: Counts will be normalized, i.e. the PDF will be visualized, or the CDF will be visualized if Cumulative is also set

NoOutliers.d: Exclude values outside the specifed histogram range from the count toward normalizing and cumulative counts

ColMajor.d: Data will be read in column major order (not supported by PlotHistogram)

enums.name: VirtualKey
enums.desc: Virtual keys that can be pressed by the user and received in scripts.
